title: Positively charged rod and grounded conductor

content.prompt: A positively charged rod is initially far from a neutral, grounded conductor and is then brought close to the conductor without touching it. If the ground wire is removed while the charged rod is near the conductor, what is the net charge on the conductor?

choices.label: There is no net charge on the conductor.
The conductor is charged, but the sign of the charge is unknown.
It cannot be determined without knowing the shape of the conductor.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
